isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - FE 300, RE 200, RE 300 - RE 200/RE 300 POWER DISTRIBUTION AND GROUNDS - TROUBLESHOOTING

svcprocinfo.para: Before beginning these test procedures, do the following:

item.para: Make sure the vehicle batteries are at 75% state of charge (SOC) or higher. This represents an open circuit voltage (OCV) of 12.4 volts. Batteries with an OCV of 12 volts or less are either completely discharged or have a dead cell.
Check any light or indicator lamp filaments that are suspected of being open (burned out). This is done to avoid unnecessary extensive circuit checks.
Inspect all connectors for loose or damaged pins, wires, etc. Refer to TEST EQUIPMENT AND CONNECTOR REPAIR section in GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL in the Master Service Manual.

When the technician determines that a fuse is blown, while checking its condition, he is directed to locate the cause of the overload condition and to repair it. While no further instruction on this procedure is listed in the diagnostic tables, the common procedure is as follows: isolate sections of the circuit by disconnecting connectors, and measure the resistance to ground to find the circuit that is shorted to ground. Then locate the damaged spot in the wire or connector and repair.

Diagnostics for circuits that are malfunctioning by sticking in the on position are generally not covered in detail. It is assumed that the technician knows to check for a malfunctioning switch, relay, or solenoid.

entry.para: At "B" stud of cranking motor solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in 4/0 red cable from battery or 3/0 cable from battery to frame ground, then repair.
At alternator stud "B," measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible links K2A-FL, K2-FL or circuit K2, then repair.
Disconnect start relay connector (6310) and measure voltage from circuit V17D to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link K17D-FL, circuits K17D or V17D, then repair.
Remove fuse A4 from fuse holder (1A) in rear engine control box (3). Measure voltage from circuit V14E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link K14B-FL, K14B, V14B or K14E, then repair. Install fuse A4.
Disconnect glow plug relay (N/L) connector and measure voltage from circuit K18 to ground.
Glow plug relay (N/L), K18 to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link K18-FL or circuit K18, then repair.
Reconnect glow plug relay connector and disconnect ECM2 power in-fuse connector (1C-A) and measure voltage from circuits 14A and 14B to ground.
Power In-line fuse (1C-A), 14A and 14B to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14A or 14B, then repair.
Reconnect power relay fuse and disconnect chassis connector (2). Measure hydraulic brake system voltage from cavity B1, circuit A90 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link N90-FL/ N90FA/A90, then repair.
At (2), measure hydraulic brake system voltage from cavity B2, circuit A90A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link N90-FL/ N90FA/A90A, then repair.
Reconnect connector (2) and at body builder feed stud (1F), measure voltage from circuit N14 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible links N14A-FL, N14-FL, or circuit N14, then repair.
Remove fuse F12. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14A to ground.
F12, cav. B, A14A to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A14A/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F12 and remove fuse F28. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14E to ground.
F28, cav. B, A14E to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A14E/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F28 and remove fuse F34. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A94 to ground.
F34, cav. B, A94 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A94/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F34 and remove fuse F14. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14C to ground.
F14, cav. B, A14C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14C/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F14 and remove fuse F16. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A19 to ground.
F16, cav. B, A19 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19/A14D, then repair. Replace fuse.
At "B" stud of cranking motor solenoid, measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in 4/0 red cable from battery or 3/0 cable from battery to frame ground, then repair.
At alternator stud "B," measure voltage to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible links K2C-FL, K2D-FL, K2E-FL or circuit K2A, then repair.
Disconnect start relay connector (6310) and measure voltage from circuit K17B to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link K17-FL or circuit K17B, then repair.
Remove fuse A4 from fuse holder (1A) in rear engine control box (3). Measure voltage from circuit V14E to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link K14B-FL/ K14B/K14E , then repair. Install fuse A4.
Disconnect ECM2 power In-line fuse (1C-A), and measure voltage from circuits 14A and 14B to ground.
Power In-line fuse (1C-A), 14A and 14B to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit 14A or 14B, then repair.
Reconnect power relay fuse and disconnect chassis connector (2). Measure hydraulic brake system voltage from cavity B1, circuit A90 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link N90-FL/ N90FA/A90, then repair.
At (2), measure hydraulic brake system voltage from cavity B2, circuit A90A to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible link N90-FL/ N90FA/A90A, then repair.
Reconnect connector (2) and at body builder feed stud (1F), measure voltage from circuit N14 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in fusible links N14A-FL, N14-FL, or circuit N14, then repair.
Remove fuse F12. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14A to ground.
F12, cav. B, A14A to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A14A/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F12 and remove fuse F28. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14E to ground.
F28, cav. B, A14E to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A14E/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F28 and remove fuse F34. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A94 to ground.
F34, cav. B, A94 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A94/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F34 and remove fuse F14. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A14C to ground.
F14, cav. B, A14C to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A14C/A14D, then repair.
Replace fuse F14 and remove fuse F16. At cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A19 to ground.
F16, cav. B, A19 to gnd.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19/A14D, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove fuse F16 and check for open condition.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of overload condition and repair. Replace fuse.
At fuse cavity B, measure voltage from circuit A19 to ground.
Fuse cav. B, A19 to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A19/A14D, then repair.
Disconnect key switch connector (20) and measure voltage from circuit A15B to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A15A/A15B, then repair.
At key switch (20), measure resistance from pin B to pin A with switch in accessory position.
At key switch (20), measure resistance from pin B to pin I with key switch in ignition position.
At key switch (20), measure resistance from pin B to pin S with switch in start position.
Reconnect key switch (20) and disconnect dash connector (2). Turn key to start position. Start interrupt at cavity G6, measure voltage from circuit A17A to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A17A, then repair.
Reconnect dash connector (2) and remove fuse F8. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A12 to ground.
F8, cav. A, A12 to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A12, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove fuse F26. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13E to ground.
F26, cav. A, A13E to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A13E, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove IGN switch relay (1711). At relay connector, measure voltage from cavity 85 to ground.
Locate cause of low or no voltage in circuit A13L, then repair.
At (1711) cavity 30, measure voltage from circuit A15 to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A15/A15B/A15A, then repair.
At (1711) cavity 86, measure voltage from circuit A11-GX to ground.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A11-GX/A11-GB then repair.
Bench test IGN switch relay by measuring resistance from cavity 30 to 87A.
Bench test IGN switch relay by applying +12 volts to cavity 85, ground to cavity 86, and measuring resistance from cavity 30 to 87.
Reconnect IGN switch relay (1711), move key switch to ignition position, at (1711) measure voltage between circuit A11-GX cavity 86, and circuit A13L cavity 85.
Locate cause of open or poor connection in circuit A13L or A11-GX/A11-GB, to ground, then repair.
At (1711) use a test lead to jumper circuit A15 cavity 30 to A13 cavity 87. Does IGN switch relay energized?
Install relay. IGN switch circuits check good.
Leave test lead connected and go to next step.
Remove fuse F20. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13A to ground.
F20, cav. A, A13A to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A13A/A13, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove fuse F25. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13H to ground.
F25, cav. A, A13H to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A13H/A13, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove fuse F23. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13F to ground.
F23, cav. A, A13F to gnd.
Replace fuse. Go to next step.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A13F/A13, then repair. Replace fuse.
Remove fuse F27. Turn key on and at cavity A, measure voltage from circuit A13C to ground.
F27, cav. A, A13C to gnd.
Locate cause of no or low voltage in circuit A13C/A13, then repair. Replace fuse.
Key switch power distribution circuits check good.
